thread.title: Update: Victims identified in Jackson Road fatal head-on collision
thread.title_full: Update: Victims identified in Jackson Road fatal head-on collision

author:
Ellen Garrison 
egarrison@sacbee.com
title: Update: Victims identified in Jackson Road fatal head-on collision
text:
March 27, 2017 6:43 AM Update: Victims identified in Jackson Road fatal head-on collision 
Covering crime, police and courts in the Sacramento region A woman and boy were killed in an early-morning crash on Jackson Road on Monday. maps4news i 
By Ellen Garrison 
A mother and her 11-year-old boy were killed in a head-on collision on Jackson Road early Monday morning, the California Highway Patrol said. 
A 1-year-old boy also was critically injured in the incident. 
The Sacramento County Coroner’s Office identified the driver as Renee Villalobos, 31, and the boy as Gerardo Villalobos, 11. Both lived in Elk Grove. 
At 3:05 a.m., they were in the front seats of a Honda Accord and the 1-year-old was in the back when their car drifted over a center turn lane and collided with a white panel van, said Officer Tommy Riggin. The crash occurred south of Rosemont between Harlin Drive and Mayhew Road, just east of Watt Avenue. 
The mother and her 11-year-old were not wearing seat belts, and the infant was not fully strapped in to a car seat, Riggin said. 
“No one was properly restrained,” Riggin said. 
Renee and Gerardo Villalobos died on impact and the 1-year-old was transported to the UC Davis Medical Center, Riggin said. He did not know the infant’s condition. 
The driver of the panel van, a Ford Transit, was conscious and alert at the scene, he said.
